Items.Title: Study: Rush to connect to Internet of Things could open security gaps
Items.Description: The rush by companies eager to incorporate the Internet of Things in their operations could introduce potential cybersecurity threats, according to a study released Monday.

Items.Title: Smart, affordable ways to develop a minimum viable product
Items.Description: Q. If I can't afford to hire in-house, what is the best approach to getting my tech product to the MVP stage and why?

Items.Title: It's as easy to find a sitter as your new Netflix show. But would you?
Items.Description: In 2016, it’s about as easy to book a babysitter as it is to order veggie egg rolls on GrubHub.

Items.Title: Scientists create a 3-armed cyborg to play drums like no human can
Items.Description: Georgia Tech researchers have built a robotic arm that attaches to a drummer's shoulder and plays along. This allows drummers - now equipped with three arms - to play sequences that two-armed humans can't even attempt.

Items.Title: The secret double meanings of emoji
Items.Description: Recently, some engineers at the visual tech firm Curalate set out to make a tool that could automatically caption Instagrams with emoji. It was a chance to mess around with computer vision -- complex models that consume such vast troves of data that...

Items.Title: How to keep going when you think your work sucks
Items.Description: “Everyone sits in the prison of his own ideas; he must burst it open.”

Items.Title: State budget impasse hits University of Illinois Research Park
Items.Description: The robust University of Illinois technology hub is feeling the pinch of the state's budget woes: It's absorbing a 6 percent funding cut that impacts support to faculty and startups.

Items.Title: Chicago tech leaders support Apple's defiance to hack terrorist's phone
Items.Description: The U.S. is on a slippery slope in asking Apple to break into a terrorist's iPhone, several Chicago tech leaders say.

Items.Title: Opternative raises $6 million to expand its online eye tests
Items.Description: Chicago startup Opternative, which offers $40 online eye tests that yield a prescription, has raised $6 million in Series A funding.

Items.Title: 15 tricks for making faster, better decisions
Items.Description: Q. What is one trick you use to make faster, better decisions?

Items.Title: TextNinja makes a game of banning texting while driving
Items.Description: A new app rewards drivers for ignoring their texts while behind the wheel, and car-sharing service Zipcar plans to give it a try on its fleet.

Items.Title: Twitter to make it easier to post GIFs
Items.Description: Twitter announced Wednesday that it will roll out a searchable library for GIFs, after users shared 100 million of the animated images on the social media platform in 2015.

Items.Title: Peanut Butter wants to help your boss pay off your student loans
Items.Description: Free catered lunches, yoga classes and video games are nice. But with student loan debt weighing on millions of Americans, employer-funded repayment programs may be the next thing millennials look for in a job.

Items.Title: 14 finalists to battle for share of $1M in Clean Energy Challenge
Items.Description: Six startups from Chicago will be among 14 companies competing for $1 million in investments in the sixth annual Clean Energy Challenge in April.

Items.Title: Why America's tech elite work entirely to fund charities
Items.Description: When Mark Zuckerberg walks into work as CEO of Facebook, he is not simply earning his keep as head of the world’s largest social network. Neither is he simply tending to his estimated net worth of $35.7 billion. He is working to give it...

Items.Title: Sprout Social raises $42M to help companies get savvy on social media
Items.Description: Chicago-based social media management company Sprout Social has raised $42 million in funding to keep up with the changing ways companies are communicating with consumers.

Items.Title: Groupon stock soars after Alibaba takes 5 percent stake
Items.Description: Groupon shares jumped on news that Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Holding Group has bought a 5.6 percent stake in the Chicago-based deals site.

Items.Title: Gogo shares fall after American Airlines threatens to change Wi-Fi carrier
Items.Description: Shares of Chicago-based Gogo were down sharply Tuesday on news that American Airlines may be seeking to end its deal with the inflight Internet provider.

Items.Title: Learn how to grow your business just like Uber
Items.Description: At a $50 billion valuation, Uber is now valued higher than 80 percent of the S&P 500. With that kind of success, it's no surprise that a legion of startup minds is racing to cash in on the same approach. Who among us doesn't want to be the founder of...
